p: The Indian Government has quickly responded to the crisis and announced a USD 22 billion relief package, which includes food and cash transfers. Several State Governments have announced their support packages. The USD 22 billion expenditure is only 0.85% of India’s GDP. This is much lower than the package passed in the USA, Europe, and some Asian countries. India should consider spending at least 4 to 5% of GDP. Even if the budget deficit increases temporarily, the Central and State Governments must spend more [43].
